results.title: Ride the high country [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Richard Lyons and Sam Peckinpah
results.brief_description: Joel McCrae and Randolph Scott are two ageing cowboys who decide to join up together to safely return a load of gold back from the goldfields to the bank that owns it. However, their motives are widely different: for one it is a chance to prove that he is still capable for work; for the other it is an opportunity to make his fortune and retire. Along the way they pick up a young woman (Mariette Hartley) running away from an abusive father. When her life is threatened their desires and dreams must take second-place to their commitment to the old West’s code of honour. Sam Peckinpah’s beautiful film is an elegy for the old West: for the morality and chivalry that guided the western hero, for the grandeur of the landscape before it was ruined by industry and mining. Using McCrae and Scott as iconic figures from the golden years of Hollywood and contrasting them to the violence represented by the new breed (Warren Oates), Peckinpah’s film also foreshadows the tension between American generations that was to become open confrontation post-Kennedy and post-Vietnam. By the end of the sixties Peckinpah was to completely destroy the western myth in his groundbreaking violent epic “The Wild Bunch”. But “Ride the High Country” is a brief moment of tenderness in the western genre, and McCrae and Scott are the last of the great western heroes. The stunning last moments of this film are an emotionally devastating farewell to American cinema’s most unique genre.

results.title: Ride straight Kate
results.creator_credit: Lynda House, Film Victoria and Tony Mahood
results.brief_description: Jason collides with a car while out riding his bicycle and is admitted to hospital. His friends decide to visit him and during their ride to and from the hospital they are confronted with several situations where accidents could occur because of their own or others’ carelessness. This program examines, in an interesting manner, safe cycling practices.

results.title: Ride On
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and John La Pointe
results.brief_description: A film on bicycle safety which begins with a comic history of the development of both the wheel and the bicycle. Six basic safety rules are stressed. Two points of difference beween Australia and Canada are that Australians ride on the left side of the road and the ‘yield’ sign is replaced by ‘give way’.

results.title: Ride like a champion
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Eric Thompson and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: Members of a Police and Citizens Boys’ Club demonstrate faulty and careless riding of bicycles. A police sergeant instructs them in the correct methods and demonstrates correct hand signals. Shows how to maintaine the bicycle and how to care for the reflector, brakes, chain, tires and the wheels. A group-cycling trip is used to illustrate elements of road care and courtesy.

results.title: Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Proteus Films, Jack Nicholson and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: When three innocent cowboys are mistaken for stagecoach robbers, they are forced to become fugitives until they clear themselves of suspicion. Before Jack Nicholson achieved fame in “Easy Rider”, his electrifying talent was evident as the writer, co-producer and star of this taut, highly charged western thriller. Co-starring Cameron Mitchell, Millie Perkins and Harry Dean Stanton.

results.title: Ride for your life
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: Profile on Mike Duff, a Canadian motor cycle racer, and the sport that nearly killed him. After a near fatal crash in Japan and extensive surgery and therapy, he returned to racing and two victories in Canada. Duff explains that he will soon give up racing, which anually takes its toll of lives of friends, and competitors. First though, his goal is world championship.

results.title: Ride against uranium
results.creator_credit: Friends of the Earth and Wolfgang Kress
results.brief_description: Follows cyclists in the “Ride Against Uranium” demonstration to their destination at Parliament House. Makes very little mention of the issues involved.

results.title: Ricky Martin: the Ricky Martin video collection
results.brief_description: Latin sensation Ricky Martin began as a member of the short-lived boy band, Menudo, before gaining a role on television soap, “General Hospital”. Becoming a solo artist, Ricky’s popularity skyrocketed in the late 1990’s with a string of hit songs including the theme song from the 1998 Soccer World Cup, ‘The Cup of Life’. This DVD includes the songs: Living La Vida Loca (in English and Spanish); She’s all I ever had (in English and Spanish); La Bomba; Perdido Sin Ti; Vuelve; Maria; The Cup of Life.

results.title: Rick Stein's seafood lovers guide
results.brief_description: Renowned chef Rick Stein takes a languid journey along the coastline of the United Kingdom in search of the best seafood places to eat and where to get the best produce when cooking fish yourself. Rick cooks an assortment of dishes using mackerel, Portland squid, dover sole, gurnard, herring, wolffish, haddock, mussels, smokies, Penclawdd oysters, monkfish, Mount’s Bay pilchards, abalone. He also calls in on the Blessing of the nets in Brighton, the Dieppe Street Market, Pilchard Press Works plus numerous other venues. Beautiful photography and delicious dishes make this a gastronomic as well as a armchair traveller’s delight.
